oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: P.A. Show
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording is of the Grand Ole Opry radio program. The recording is from April 7, 1955. This tape features Hank Snow, Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys, Minnie Pearl, Del Woods, Jordanaires and Chester Atkins. Tape is the second of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Bill Monroe;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Martha White's flour commercial -- (00:28) Commercial for Harvey, Nashville's largest store -- (01:20) The Grand Ole Opry starring Hank Snow intro -- (01:30) Would You Mind (Hank Snow) -- (03:12) All Star Country Music Line Up introduction -- (04:55) Go On By (Jordanaires) -- (05:43) Host talks with Hank Snow about April Fools pranks and PA tobacco -- (06:46) Host introduces Bill Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys -- (07:25) Close By (Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys) -- (10:02) Host begins square dance time -- (11:01) He'll Understand and Say Well Done (Hank Snow) -- (13:37) Prince Albert (PA) tobacco commercial -- (14:45) Host introduces Del Woods -- (14:55) Smokey Mountains Polka (Del Woods) -- (16:21) Host introduces Minnie Pearl -- (16:42) Minnie Pearl and host talk about her brother -- (20:36) Huntin' Season (Minnie Pearl) -- (21:22) Host reintroduces Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys -- (21:27) Cheyenne (Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys) -- (23:49) Host congratulates radio station WOW in Nebraska for 32 years on air -- (24:11) John Henry (Chester Atkins) -- (25:49) Host gives Hank Snow with award for Outstanding Country Record for "I Don't Hurt Anymore" -- (26:19) Hank Snow gives thanks for the award -- (26:42) Yellow Roses (Hank Snow) -- (29:19) Hank Snow previews next weeks episode and says goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys -- (Musical group); Pearl, Minnie; Wood, Del; Grand Ole Opry (Radio program); Atkins, Chet; Jordanaires -- (Musical group);
